image.altText: A smiling boy with zinc on his face at the beach.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy killed by a shark at a popular tourism and surfing location on South Australia's Yorke Peninsula is being remembered as a "talented and dearly loved" young surfer.

title.children: Teen shark attack victim identified, as tributes flow for 'dearly loved' surfer

image.altText: A woman mines in Porgera

props.synopsis: PNG's Porgera gold mine could potentially transform the fortunes of an impoverished province now that it has reopened. But some locals say they've experienced considerable environmental damage from the mine's waste and tailings.

title.children: $7bn of gold is buried in these PNG hills. The battle to claim it has been called 'Game of Thrones on crack'

image.altText: A family of four smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Rockhampton community rallies around Bronwyn Nunn and her children, after her husband Tony died from cancer and just hours later a fire destroyed their home.

title.children: Within hours on Boxing Day, this family lost their husband and father, and then their home

image.altText: Australia bowler Nathan Lyon goes down on one knee and throws his hands up to appeal for a wicket in a Test against Pakistan.

props.synopsis: Australia is dismissed for 262 on day four of the Boxing Day Test, leaving Pakistan a difficult chase of 317 runs to tie the series at the MCG. Follow live.

title.children: Australia gets one wicket but misses out on another as Pakistan chases 317 to win MCG Test

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: LBW! SHAN MASOOD IS GIVEN OUT LBW! BUT IT'S OVERTURNED

image.altText: Woman wearing snorkel in the water under very blue sky.

props.synopsis: Wheelchair-user Chris Kerr has snorkelled at the Abrolhos Islands for the first time and says new devices are opening up a "whole new world" of adventure for people with disabilities or mobility issues.

title.children: 'It's just so beautiful': Snorkelling in paradise now possible with mobility aids

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Maine’s Democratic secretary of state has removed former US president Donald Trump from the state’s presidential primary ballot under the Constitution’s insurrection clause

title.children: Maine bars Trump from ballot as US Supreme Court weighs state authority to block former president

image.altText: Pedestrians are reflected in a window with an indicator board displaying stock prices at the Australian Stock Exchange in Sydney

props.synopsis: The ASX has opened lower after a mixed session on Wall Street overnight, the Australian dollar has slipped a little and Brent Crude has pared back. Follow along on the markets blog.

title.children: ASX opens lower on last trading day of 2023, dollar slips overnight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What will happen to house prices in 2024?
Boeing urges 737 MAX inspections for possible loose bolt
Google settles $US5 billion consumer privacy lawsuit

image.altText: A man runs his hand across a green couch.

props.synopsis: Consumers and business are embracing the circular economy, with some big retailers even buying back and reselling their old goods.

title.children: Cost-of-living crunch sees more retailers give products a second lease of life

image.altText: Mawson Station, Antarctica

props.synopsis: The Australian Antarctic Division's bid to improve culture and morale within its workforce continues to face significant hurdles, with an internal survey showing almost a third of female respondents not reporting the harassment and bullying they've experienced or seen in recent months.

title.children: 'Trust has been shattered': Leaked survey reveals ongoing cultural issues at Australian Antarctic Division

image.altText: Anastasia Ivleeva posted for a picture with GeeGun during an almost naked party. She's in a lacey black bra. He's shirtless.

props.synopsis: Russian authorities crack down on celebrities who attended a racy costume party in a Moscow nightclub, as the Kremlin continues to pursue an increasingly conservative regime.

title.children: 'Almost naked' party of Russian elites brings jail time, a lawsuit and apologies

image.altText: Man standing in front of large tree

props.synopsis: The "tornado" that hit on Christmas Day was the biggest disaster the region has ever faced, according to Scenic Rim mayor Greg Christensen.

title.children: All Jack heard was a cracking sound before a tree split his home in half in Queensland's 'tornado' storm

image.altText: Photo of woman with running shoes and in running gear smiling

props.synopsis: Tanya Hehir, 46, was one of three women who went exploring the so-called "love tunnel" in Gympie. Police said the women, including another 40-year-old who also died, had been washed back through the drain into Mary River.

title.children: Police confirm identity of woman who died while exploring 'love tunnel' stormwater drain in Gympie

image.altText: Palestinian woman Iman holds her newborn twins Uday and Hamza Abu Odah at Nasser hospital.

props.synopsis: Doctors and residents say women in Gaza are giving birth in horrific and dangerous conditions, with mothers and their babies dying after childbirth due to a lack of medical supplies. WARNING: This story contains distressing content.

title.children: There are 180 babies born in Gaza every day but doctors say a safe labour is nearly 'impossible'

image.altText: A medium shot of a number of people, including children, sitting and standing amid mattresses in the tray of a truck

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of already displaced Palestinian families take part in a new mass exodus in central Gaza.

title.children: New exodus of thousands causes havoc in central Gaza as Israeli forces advance

image.altText: paraglider over sandy beach dunes

props.synopsis: Paramedics worked on a man after a paraglider crash in an area of the high country noted for the sport but he died at the scene.

title.children: Victorian high country community in shock after death of paraglider

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: the exterior of beenleigh courthouse, a high concrete wall

props.synopsis: Police allege the man stole a car with two young children seated in the back on Christmas Day.

title.children: Queensland man charged over alleged robbery and kidnapping of two children on Christmas Day

image.altText: A woman with eczema and glasses looks at herself in the mirror.

props.synopsis: Sufferers of the sometimes-debilitating skin condition are being urged to take steps to prepare now, with pollen and heat predicted to make the painful condition of eczema worse this summer.

title.children: Pollen and heat could make painful condition of eczema worse this summer — here's what to do

image.altText: A man rides a horse, cutting cattle in an arena.

props.synopsis: Casino horseman Neil Flynn has a knack for finding diamonds in the rough and turning them into performance horse champions.

title.children: How a 79-year-old cowboy and a $250 steed claimed glory in a contest where horses can cost half a million

image.altText: Yellow police tape strung in front of a house

props.synopsis: The house where four University of Idaho students were killed last year was demolished on Thursday, marking an emotional step for the victims' families and a close-knit community that was shocked and devastated by the brutal stabbings.

title.children: House where four University of Idaho students were killed is demolished

image.altText: Douglas damage

props.synopsis: Locals in parts of flood-devastated Far North Queensland are left without drinking water as authorities race to fix a badly damaged water treatment plant in aftermath of ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper.

title.children: Residents lose drinking water as landslips triggered by flooding damage treatment plant

image.altText: Rescuers stand by wreckage of a passenger plane that crashed in Pokhara, Nepal.

props.synopsis: A Yeti Airlines crash in Nepal that killed 72 people almost a year ago was caused by the pilots mistakenly cutting power leading to an aerodynamic stall.

title.children: Investigative panel finds deadly Nepal crash was due to pilot error

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A racing driver in a red racing suit, looking to the sky, pumping his fists, in front of cheers fans

props.synopsis: The story of Schumacher and his skiing accident is not fully known, with his family electing to keep the German's private life well out of public view.

title.children: A decade since his life-changing ski accident, the health of Michael Schumacher remains a guarded secret

image.altText: A young mother leans down over her sleeping baby, kissing her on the cheek.

props.synopsis: Paramedic Dominique Daye felt confident she would take being a mum in her stride, but it wasn't what she expected. She's encouraging others to use new support tools when things get tough.

title.children: Dominique suffered postpartum psychosis after her son's birth. She wants new parents to know help is available

image.altText: An aerial view of the small NT town of Larrimah.

props.synopsis: Years after one of its dozen residents vanished without a trace, a Netflix documentary is bringing a global audience of millions to the mystery that looms over the remote Northern Territory town of Larrimah.

title.children: How a tiny Aussie outback town became a global true-crime phenomenon

image.altText: A Brisbane Roar A-League Men player reacts after missing a shot on goal against Melbourne City.

props.synopsis: In the wake of Ross Aloisi's departure on Christmas Eve, the Roar fall to a 8-1 thrashing at the hands of Melbourne City, the result equalling the heaviest defeat in A-League Men history.

title.children: Brisbane Roar concede eight goals less than a week after coach's shock resignation

image.altText: Brown mud crab sits on carton of beer.

props.synopsis: With the first detailed research underway near Derby, there are hopes the region's local community could play a role in the developing commercial fishery.

title.children: Now that's a crab! Hopes research will lead to Indigenous-owned fishery for giant Kimberley mud crabs

image.altText: Girl in pajamas on coach, blowing her nose with a long-haired cat on her lap

props.synopsis: Humans have been living alongside cats and dogs for thousands of years. But that doesn't mean we're always compatible. What can you do as an animal lover with pet allergies?

title.children: Do you love animals but are allergic to pets? It still may be possible to have a furry friend

image.altText: Photo illustration showing rise in elder abuse reports in NSW

props.synopsis: Assaults reported at aged care homes in NSW have risen to the highest level in a decade, according to the Bureau of Crime Statistics and Reporting.

title.children: NSW Police recorded more than 4,600 aged care home incidents in a year. Experts say it's a sign of a bigger issue

image.altText: Labelling on a packet of Doritos corn chips.

props.synopsis: A union claims workers at a Smith's Chips factory in Adelaide have been experiencing breathing difficulties and skin irritation from a seasoning used on a spicy snack food.

title.children: Spicy Doritos seasoning leaving factory workers with 'skin irritation' and 'difficulty breathing', union claims

image.altText: A watercolour illustration of a woman in her 70s looking pensive, with her hands held up to her face.

props.synopsis: As Adelaide-based novelist Carol Lefevre approached 70 years of age, she was struck with a strange feeling of homesickness — not for a place, but for a time.

title.children: 'No amount of regret is going to do us any good': How to embrace ageing
